message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1500000.
I'm interested in the product, but $1500000 is a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $900000 for it.

I understand that $900000 is a bit lower than what I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1200000, which is the minimum price I'm willing to accept. If you're not comfortable with that, I'm happy to negotiate further.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1200000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $1000000 for the product, which is the highest price I'm willing to pay. Can you meet me in the middle again?

I understand that $1000000 is still a bit lower than what I'm comfortable with, but I'm willing to make one more concession. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1100000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, so I hope we can come to an agreement.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $1100000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $950000 for the product, which is the lowest price I'm willing to pay. Can you reconsider?
